column9: Saw lots of new, exciting things
column10: The garbage and smell by the creek
column11: Get to see more of the creek. Activities were too short, especially Saturday

column9: It gave me the opportunity to get to know other persons who are also doing conservation work.
column10: The rest room at the school was not clean.
column11: Maybe provide transportation to get more people involved.

column10: I think elaborating more on what is expected from participants would have been helpful

column9: Although it was insects I mostly saw, I was amazed by the biodiversity of insects in just a small section of grassland. Talking about the cool finds with the other members of the group was fun too!
column10: For my group we had to pass behind peopleâ€™s houses, so Iâ€™m guessing itâ€™s in their yard. Iâ€™m not sure how understanding people can be for events like this. But luckily no one was around or angry about us passing through their property. I was just a little skeptical about that.
column11: A more punctual start for each event, and advertising the Bioblitz earlier in the year and also consistently advertising to increase the amount of people showing up and participating. Maybe even collecting some specimens and talking about them after everyone has returned back to the starting point.
Security considerations and dynamic group planning so each group can cover several focuses at once (insects, birds/mammals, plants, aquatic testing, etc)

column9: The booths and how educational it was
column10: The area maybe, I thought it was gonna be more jungle looking
column11: Maybe more booths n invite more people over

column9: I liked the hands on experience the Bioblitz presented. It was enjoyable to go out and explore the biodiversity present at Mt. Pleasant Creek. I also like the execution of the event was properly planned out and I commend the Environmental Clubâ€™s Executive team as well as the experts present. Thank you for presenting new opportunities and activities for your members!!
column10: I think that instead of the team scattering to make observations maybe we can stick together a bit more and do the observations together. Or have a time dedicated for this before scattering.
column11: There isnâ€™t much recommendations because it was an excellent event. My only recommendation is to make the conduction of the observations together in order to ensure everyone has more interaction and have the experts give more details on the species observed.

column9: seeing the different types of animals that we have around our community
Seeing people getting excited about what they were finding and learning from others.
column10: Not having a macro lens for my phone
column11: I would focus more on aquatic flora and fauna.

column9: Being out in the open and sharing  the enthusiasm of all the other participants
column10: That I didnâ€™t sing up for other activities ðŸ˜€
column11: From a birding perspective I think it was well organized

column9: I enjoyed seeing the different types of species that were at Mount Pleasant Creek. I had no idea so many animals were there. It was so much fun!
column10: The event itself was amazing. There is nothing I did not like.
column11: Handle the sign-ups in a different way. Also, to get organizers that are more dedicated to the planning stage.

column9: The community participation in the Bioblitz
The participation of everyone and also the knowledge shared from all the experts! I got to learn a lot
I liked the field work section ,where we had to be turning over logs and other objects to find species and upload them to the inaturalists app .
